pageContent: The oligometastatic state of prostate cancer (PC) is of clinical importance because of its implications for surgery, radiotherapy, and systemic therapy. Improving the definition of oligometastatic PC will offer an opportunity to discover whether disease burden is a clinically meaningful variable or if oligometastasis is a distinctive state of PC with a largely unexplored biological background.
